paper_title.ja: Fern Constituents : Triterpenoids of Polypodiodes amoena :
paper_title.en: Fern Constituents : Triterpenoids of Polypodiodes amoena

description.ja: From a Polypodiaceous fern, Polypodiodes amoena (type species of Polypodiodes) 29 triterpenoids including a new natural product, 20-hydroxylupane, were isolated and characterized. Comparison of the triterpenoids from this fern and other Polypodiodes species with those of ferns of the relating genera clearly indicated that the genus Potypodiodes is a genus chemotaxonomically distinguished from the genera Polypodium and Goniophlebium.
description.en: From a Polypodiaceous fern, Polypodiodes amoena (type species of Polypodiodes) 29 triterpenoids including a new natural product, 20-hydroxylupane, were isolated and characterized. Comparison of the triterpenoids from this fern and other Polypodiodes species with those of ferns of the relating genera clearly indicated that the genus Potypodiodes is a genus chemotaxonomically distinguished from the genera Polypodium and Goniophlebium.

paper_title.ja: GC-MS Studies on Ester Components of Spermaceti :
paper_title.en: GC-MS Studies on Ester Components of Spermaceti

description.ja: Seven specimens of spermaceti, collected in Herbarium of several universities, were studied by the GC-MS technique. They were classified into two types, A and B. Both A and B gave several peaks in GC, and each peak was shown to be of many kinds of saturated aliphatic esters by their MS peaks. Although the main constituent of spermaceti has been believed to be cetyl palmitate, the most abundant esters were cetyl myristate and cetyl laurate or cetyl palmitate (type A) and octyl stearate and octyl palmitate (type B). Type A was considered to be crystalline wax esters genuinely separated from head cavities of sperm whale, and type B to be crystalline wax esters of hydrogenated head cavities of sperm whale.
description.en: Seven specimens of spermaceti, collected in Herbarium of several universities, were studied by the GC-MS technique. They were classified into two types, A and B. Both A and B gave several peaks in GC, and each peak was shown to be of many kinds of saturated aliphatic esters by their MS peaks. Although the main constituent of spermaceti has been believed to be cetyl palmitate, the most abundant esters were cetyl myristate and cetyl laurate or cetyl palmitate (type A) and octyl stearate and octyl palmitate (type B). Type A was considered to be crystalline wax esters genuinely separated from head cavities of sperm whale, and type B to be crystalline wax esters of hydrogenated head cavities of sperm whale.

paper_title.en: Fern Constituents : Six New Triterpenoid Alcohols from Adiantum capillus-veneris
PERACID OXIDATIVE REARRANGEMENTS OF TRITERPEIVOIDS : PRODUCTS OF NEW SKELETON FROM BAUERENYL ACETATE
Triterpenoids from the fern Goniophlebium mengtzeense

description.en: Two new triterpenoids, fern-9(11)-en-20α-yl palmitate and 8βH-fern- 9(11)-en-7-one were isolated from the fresh fronds of Goniophlebium mengtzeense. Their structures were established by spectroscopic techniques and chemical correlation. Thirty-seven other compounds were identified from this fern.

paper_title.ja: シダ植物のケモタキソノミー (V) 日本産Polystichum属について
paper_title.en: Chemotaxonomy of Fern Plants (V) : Japanese Polystichum Species

description.ja: γ-Polypodatetraene (6), the first example of a bicyclic triterpenoid hydrocarbon, has been isolated from fresh leaflets of Polystichum polyblepharum and its structure has been elucidated on the basis of Mass, ^1H- and ^<13>C-NMR spectral analyses. More than 30 species and 40 hybrids in the genus Polystichum are known in Japan. Further investigation on the some species of this genus, led us to the finding that Polystichum species contained mainly hopane and migrated hopane triterpenoids, viz. hop-22(29)-ene (1), fern-9(11)-ene (2), hydroxyhopane (3), dryocrassol (4), dryocrassyl acetate (5) along with the other type triterpenoids, viz. γ-polypodatetraene (6), squalene (7), α-polypodatetraene (8), dammara-18(28),21-diene (9) and a diterpenoid, phytol (10). On the basis of their triterpenoid (6, 8) and diterpenoid (10) profiles, those 16 Japanese Polystichum species could be divided into three groups chemotaxonomically.
description.en: γ-Polypodatetraene (6), the first example of a bicyclic triterpenoid hydrocarbon, has been isolated from fresh leaflets of Polystichum polyblepharum and its structure has been elucidated on the basis of Mass, ^1H- and ^<13>C-NMR spectral analyses. More than 30 species and 40 hybrids in the genus Polystichum are known in Japan. Further investigation on the some species of this genus, led us to the finding that Polystichum species contained mainly hopane and migrated hopane triterpenoids, viz. hop-22(29)-ene (1), fern-9(11)-ene (2), hydroxyhopane (3), dryocrassol (4), dryocrassyl acetate (5) along with the other type triterpenoids, viz. γ-polypodatetraene (6), squalene (7), α-polypodatetraene (8), dammara-18(28),21-diene (9) and a diterpenoid, phytol (10). On the basis of their triterpenoid (6, 8) and diterpenoid (10) profiles, those 16 Japanese Polystichum species could be divided into three groups chemotaxonomically.
